title: Michel Petrucciani discography
description:
Dig the genius of Michel Petrucciani
 <a href="
http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Michel_Petrucciani" rel="nofollow" target="_NEW">
http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Michel_Petrucciani</a>

Life was always a struggle for Michel, but he was nevertheless one of the greatest artists in modern jazz.
I remember when I saw him in a live concert some time before his premature death in 1999.
At first sight you could have been scared of his appearance. He seemed some elvish dwarf.
But you forgot soon this nuance when those long hands started to explore the piano keyboard.
It was after that concert that I started to dig seriously jazz music.

Building up this discography I've noticed that he's not remembered so much nowadays.
Probably cause he's french and not anglo-saxon.
Probably cause he left us too soon.
I dont know...
I found a great mess about the real extension of his discography, the release dates and so on.
I've tried to put together all the material I found - and anyway you won't find all this stuff together anywhere else :)
The discography is pretty complete in his main albums and with several collaborations too. 
You won't find some of the usual compilation marmalades that labels usually do when they want to reboost their sales.
Simply I could not find them all.
But I found some rare live bootlegs with more than sufficient quality that I deem far more valuable.
Jazz music can be tasted at its best when played alive. :)

There are 55 albums.
The sampling rate is 320kbps for most of them.
Different rates are signed in the name of the albums.
Enjoy :)
